alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS... Thunderstorms will affect the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness this evening through early Tuesday morning. Strong to severe thunderstorms are forecast. Damaging wind gusts of 60 to 80 mph, large hail up to two-inches in diameter, a few tornadoes, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and torrential rainfall which could lead to flash flooding of creeks, streams, and low-lying areas. Campers should take extra precautions in order to secure campsites and make a plan in case of severe weather. Check campsites for possible hazards, including standing dead trees or limbs, as well as low spots where water can pool. Move tents away from creeks and rivers to protect against flash flooding. Prepare to protect yourself from large hail using sleeping bags or other padded items. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
